intro: Clidemia killipii, commonly known as the Hawaiian stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine, stinging hairs. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Clidemia killipii plays an important role in the ecological balance of Hawaiian ecosystems.
